popt4jlib

Class ShiftedArgFunctionBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • popt4jlib.ShiftedArgFunctionBase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, FunctionIntf

    public class ShiftedArgFunctionBase
extends java.lang.Object
implements FunctionIntf
    The class is a wrapper class for FunctionIntf objects, that evaluates the FunctionIntf object not on the actual VectorIntf or double[] argument x that it is given, but rather on a shifted vector x-δ, where the shift δ is passed in the params hashtable as a pair <"function.shiftarg", double[] delta>. However, if it is passed a non-vector of doubles argument, the eval() method simply passes along the argument to the underlying function without shifting it, since it does not know how to do the shifting.

    Notes:

    • 20190701: modified eval() to return Double.MAX_VALUE when the underlying function returns NaN.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011-2019

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou

      double eval(java.lang.Object arg, java.util.HashMap params)
      evaluates the function f passed in during construction of this object at the point arg-delta where delta is a double[] found in the params under the key "function.shiftarg".

    • Method Detail

      • eval

        public double eval(java.lang.Object arg,
                   java.util.HashMap params)
        evaluates the function f passed in during construction of this object at the point arg-delta where delta is a double[] found in the params under the key "function.shiftarg". If the arg is a VectorIntf object, the evaluation will be rather slow as there will be conversions from one data type to the other, and object creations.
        Specified by:
        eval in interface FunctionIntf
        Parameters:
        arg - Object must be double[] or VectorIntf
        params - HashMap
        Returns:
        double
